questions.text: A fetus diagnosed with neural tube defect at 21 weeks. The parents want an MTP at 21 weeks. What opinions are required?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Opinion of 2 doctors

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For pregnancies between 20 and 24 weeks , the opinion of two doctors is required to perform a medical termination of pregnancy, especially in cases where the fetus has a serious abnormality such as a neural tube defect .
  • ➤ 20 and 24 weeks
  • ➤ opinion of two doctors
  • ➤ neural tube defect

questions.text: A 27-year G3P2 with 2 previous cesarean sections presents at 32 weeks. An ultrasound done at 30 weeks which shows an anterior placenta previa. placenta is low lying and anterior. On examination, her PR – 80/ min, BP – 110/70mmHg. Abdominal exam reveals a uterus of 32 weeks, cephalic presentation and FHR – 150 bpm. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Order a color Doppler

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with a history of placenta previa and previous cesarean section , the risk of placenta accreta increases. The best next step is to perform a color Doppler ultrasound to rule out placenta accreta spectrum disorders.
  • ➤ placenta previa
  • ➤ previous cesarean section
  • ➤ placenta accreta
  • ➤ color Doppler ultrasound
  • ➤ placenta accreta spectrum

questions.text: A 34-year woman presents to the OPD with a history of 3-months amenorrhoea and mild vaginal bleeding. Her UPT is positive. She says an ultrasound was done a few days earlier but she has misplaced the report and has only the image as shown below. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Call her after 2 weeks for review ultrasound

questions.correct_answer: C. Admit for suction and evacuation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Admit for suction and evacuation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of suspected molar pregnancy (indicated by the snowstorm appearance on ultrasound), the definitive management is suction and evacuation . This prevents further complications and allows for monitoring of hCG levels to ensure complete resolution of the molar tissue.
  • ➤ molar pregnancy
  • ➤ snowstorm appearance
  • ➤ suction and evacuation

questions.text: The following maneuver is performed in which situation?

options.label: A
options.text: To deliver the after-coming head in breech delivery

options.label: B
options.text: To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery

options.label: C
options.text: To keep the back anterior during breech delivery

options.label: D
options.text: To ensure enough space is there for applying forceps in breech delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) To deliver nuchal arms in breech delivery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Løvset maneuver is used during breech delivery to deliver nuchal arms . Understanding various maneuvers in breech delivery helps manage complications and ensure safe delivery for both the mother and baby.
  • ➤ Løvset maneuver
  • ➤ nuchal arms

questions.text: A mother brought her 16-year-old daughter to the hospital with complaints of primary amenorrhea. On evaluation axillary and pubic hair were present and other secondary sexual characteristics normal. LH and FSH levels are normal, and USG shows an absent uterus. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) MRKH syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MRKH syndrome is characterized by the presence of normal secondary sexual characteristics, normal hormone levels, and the absence of the uterus or part of the vagina in an individual with a 46,XX karyotype. It is one of the most common causes of primary amenorrhea with normal secondary sexual development.

questions.text: A young recently married couple presents to the OPD. They give a history of unprotected intercourse 4 days back. She is very anxious as they do not want a pregnancy at present. What is the next best step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Prescribe Ulipristal acetate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ulipristal acetate is the most effective form of emergency contraception when taken up to 120 hours (5 days) after unprotected intercourse.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a risk factor for epithelial ovarian cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Combined oral contraceptive pills

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Combined oral contraceptive pills reduce epithelial ovarian cancer risk by suppressing ovulation and decreasing epithelial cell turnover.

questions.text: What hormones are secreted by the Leydig cells and the Sertoli cells respectively?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Testosterone and AMH

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leydig cells secrete testosterone, which is essential for the development of male internal genitalia, while Sertoli cells secrete anti-Müllerian hormone (AMH) to prevent the development of female reproductive organs.

questions.text: A 23-year primi came to the emergency department at 35 weeks of pregnancy with pedal edema and BP of 140/90 mmHg. A urine dipstick was 2+. Her investigations are as listed below. Hb – 9.2g%, RBS – 123, SGOT – 250, SGPT- 300, Creatinine-0.7, platelet: 50000. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Corticosteroids followed by induction of labor

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Induction of labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of severe preeclampsia after 34 weeks of pregnancy, immediate delivery is indicated to prevent maternal and fetal complications.
  • ➤ severe preeclampsia

questions.text: A 34-year G2 presented with eclampsia at 36 weeks. She was started on MgSO4 and following induction of labor she delivered a female baby 4h earlier. She is currently on maintenance MgSO4. On examination you note that the patient is drowsy. Her PR is 90/ min, BP is 150/100 mmHg and RR is 12/min. The uterus is well contracted and on local exam, there is some vaginal bleeding. Her urine output is 30ml/h since the past 4 hours. Deep tendon reflexes are noted to be sluggish. What is your diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Magnesium toxicity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Magnesium toxicity can occur in patients receiving MgSO4 for eclampsia and is characterized by sluggish reflexes, respiratory depression, drowsiness, and decreased urine output . Immediate management includes discontinuation of MgSO4 and administration of calcium gluconate as an antidote.
  • ➤ Magnesium toxicity
  • ➤ sluggish reflexes, respiratory depression, drowsiness, and decreased urine output

questions.text: A 35-year primigravida is worried about the risk of her baby having Down syndrome. Which is not a screening test for Down syndrome?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Amniocentesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Amniocentesis is a diagnostic test for Down syndrome, whereas other methods like cell free DNA , nuchal translucency , and the quadruple marker are screening tests that assess the risk of chromosomal abnormalities.
  • ➤ Amniocentesis
  • ➤ diagnostic
  • ➤ cell free DNA
  • ➤ nuchal translucency
  • ➤ quadruple marker
  • ➤ screening tests

questions.text: A 36-year woman presents to the gyn OPD with secondary amenorrhoea. She has 1 child who is 8-years-old, and she had a surgical termination of pregnancy done a year earlier. She says her mother attained menopause in her late thirties. Examination reveals a normal sized uterus and no adnexal mass is palpable. Her pregnancy test is negative and her FSH is normal for her age. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Asherman syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Asherman syndrome is a condition that occurs after uterine trauma, typically after procedures like D&C, leading to intrauterine adhesions and secondary amenorrhea.
  • ➤ Asherman syndrome

questions.text: As per the WHO Labor Care Guide, at what cervical dilatation should active phase begin?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 5cm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The active phase of labor begins at 5 cm of cervical dilatation, and recognizing this phase is important in managing labor progression and providing timely interventions if needed.
  • ➤ active phase of labor
  • ➤ 5 cm

questions.text: A 53-year P1 presents to the OPD with a h/o post menopausal bleeding since a few days. She gives a history of traveling and attributes it to the stress. She attained menopause 1 year earlier. On examination, the cervix is normal and minimal blood is seen at the os. A TVS reveals an endometrial thickness of 8mm. What is the next best step?

options.label: D
options.text: Review if another episode of bleeding

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Office endometrial biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Postmenopausal bleeding should be investigated to rule out endometrial cancer . The next best step is an office endometrial biopsy or transvaginal ultrasound to assess the endometrial thickness and histological analysis.
  • ➤ endometrial cancer
  • ➤ office endometrial biopsy
  • ➤ transvaginal ultrasound

questions.text: A 45-year P4L4 woman presents to the OPD with post coital bleeding. On examination there is a 2 cm growth seen on the cervix which bleeds on touch. The vagina is normal and the parametrium is free. A biopsy reveals squamous cell carcinoma. What is the best management option for her?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Radical hysterectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For early-stage cervical cancer (IB1, with a tumor ≤4 cm and no parametrial involvement), the best treatment option is radical hysterectomy . This surgical approach is curative for early stages of the disease.
  • ➤ early-stage cervical cancer
  • ➤ radical hysterectomy

questions.text: Identify the hormone responsible for the rise in temperature as shown in the image:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Progesterone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Progesterone is the hormone responsible for the rise in basal body temperature during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle. This thermal shift occurs after ovulation and is a physiological marker of the luteal phase.
  • ➤ Progesterone
  • ➤ basal body temperature

questions.text: A 24-year is referred for colposcopy from the primary health center in view of a suspicious looking cervix for which the midwife has sent you the image shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Trichomonas vaginalis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Colpitis macularis (strawberry cervix) is a hallmark finding in Trichomonas vaginalis infection , characterized by punctate hemorrhages on the cervix. This appearance helps differentiate trichomoniasis from other causes of cervicitis or cervical lesions.
  • ➤ Colpitis macularis
  • ➤ Trichomonas vaginalis infection

questions.text: A 48-year woman brings her 15-year-old daughter to the OPD. Her 65-year-old mother has been recently diagnosed with cervical cancer and she wants to enquire about the HPV vaccine for her and her daughter. What is the correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: HPV vaccine for both the woman and her daughter is advised

options.label: B
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

options.label: C
options.text: HPV vaccine should be given only to the woman

options.label: D
options.text: There is no role of the HPV vaccine

questions.correct_answer: B. HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) HPV vaccine should be given only to her daughter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The HPV vaccine is recommended for girls and women between the ages of 9 and 26 years , and a catch-up vaccination is possible until 45 years with certain vaccines, although this is not universally applied in all countries. It is most effective when given before sexual activity begins to prevent HPV-related cancers and diseases.
  • ➤ HPV vaccine
  • ➤ 9 and 26 years
  • ➤ catch-up vaccination
  • ➤ 45 years

questions.text: A 15-year-old female presents with primary amenorrhea. She however has a cramping abdominal pain every month since a year. Her secondary sexual characters are normal. Abdominal exam reveals an abdominal lump and on parting the labia a bluish bulge is noted. What is the appropriate management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Cruciate incision on the hymen
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cruciate incision on the hymen

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of imperforate hymen , which presents with primary amenorrhea, cyclic abdominal pain, and a bluish bulge at the vaginal introitus, the appropriate management is a cruciate incision on the hymen to relieve the obstruction and allow normal menstrual flow.
  • ➤ imperforate hymen
  • ➤ cruciate incision on the hymen

questions.text: In which of the following conditions, a hysteroscopy can be done?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Asherman syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hysteroscopy is an effective tool for diagnosing and treating intrauterine conditions such as Asherman syndrome. It allows direct visualization of the uterine cavity and can be used therapeutically for adhesiolysis, polypectomy, and resection of intrauterine fibroids.

questions.text: Which of the following is commonly associated with this type of pelvis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Obstructed labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The android pelvis , characterized by a heart-shaped structure and prominent ischial spines , is commonly associated with obstructed labor due to its restrictive shape, which hinders the smooth descent of the fetal head.
  • ➤ android pelvis
  • ➤ heart-shaped
  • ➤ prominent ischial spines
  • ➤ obstructed labor

questions.text: A 35-year woman presents to the emergency with severe dysmenorrhoea not responding to NSAIDs. She gives a history of worsening dysmenorrhoea and also has pain when passing stools. She does not give a history of constipation. Her periods are otherwise regular. On bimanual examination, the uterus is fixed and retroverted. On further history, she reveals that she hasn’t conceived despite being married for 3-years for which she was planning to show the gynecologist. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Endometriosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endometriosis should be suspected in women presenting with chronic pelvic pain, dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and infertility , particularly when a fixed retroverted uterus is noted on examination. Dyschezia (pain with defecation) is another common symptom when endometrial implants involve the rectal area.
  • ➤ Endometriosis
  • ➤ chronic pelvic pain, dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and infertility
  • ➤ fixed retroverted uterus
  • ➤ Dyschezia

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman accompanied by her mother-in-law comes to the infertility clinic. Her periods are regular and she has been having regular intercourse for 6 months but is not able to conceive. What is the next best step?

options.label: B
options.text: Reassure and review the couple after 6 months

questions.correct_answer: B. Reassure and review the couple after 6 months
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Reassure and review the couple after 6 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In women under 35, infertility is defined as the inability to conceive after 12 months of unprotected intercourse. It is appropriate to reassure and wait before starting any diagnostic tests or treatments. For women over 35 or with known risk factors, earlier investigation may be warranted.

questions.text: A 21-year unmarried girl presents to the OPD with increasing weight gain and acne. On asking, she says her period are regular. On examination, her BMI is 28. An ultrasound reveals the following in 1 ovary. What is the best treatment option?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Optimize BMI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For women with PCOS and a BMI above the normal range , lifestyle modification and weight loss are the first-line treatments. These measures can significantly improve metabolic, reproductive, and dermatologic symptoms without needing immediate pharmacologic intervention.
  • ➤ PCOS
  • ➤ BMI above the normal range
  • ➤ lifestyle modification
  • ➤ weight loss

questions.text: A 30-year primi presents at 32 weeks with abdominal discomfort. She is unable to perceive fetal movements since a few days. On examination, the uterus is 36 weeks with flanks full. The fetal parts are not easily palpable, and the fetal heart rate is faint. An ultrasound is ordered. Which of the following will you expect to find on the ultrasound?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) AFI > 25

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a patient presenting with a larger-than-expected uterine size, difficulty palpating fetal parts, and faint fetal heart tones, polyhydramnios is a likely diagnosis, and an AFI > 25 cm on ultrasound would be expected. Polyhydramnios can complicate pregnancy and may lead to poor perception of fetal movements and difficulty in clinical assessment.
  • ➤ polyhydramnios
  • ➤ AFI > 25 cm

questions.text: You are conducting the delivery of a 24-year primigravida. Following crowning, the head is born by?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Extension

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ After crowning , the fetal head is delivered by extension . This allows the head to pass through the birth canal and beneath the pubic symphysis, completing the delivery of the head.
  • ➤ crowning
  • ➤ extension

questions.text: On performing a laparoscopic procedure for an ectopic pregnancy, the following image was seen at the hepatic area. What could have been the possible cause of the ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) PID

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fitz-Hugh-Curtis syndrome , characterized by violin-string adhesions , is associated with Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) . PID is a major risk factor for ectopic pregnancy , as it leads to scarring and damage in the fallopian tubes.
  • ➤ Fitz-Hugh-Curtis syndrome
  • ➤ violin-string adhesions
  • ➤ Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID)
  • ➤ ectopic pregnancy

questions.text: Maximum causes of female infertility are attributed to which cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ovarian causes of infertility, including ovulatory dysfunction, diminished ovarian reserve, and premature ovarian failure, are the most common contributors to female infertility.
  • ➤ Ovarian causes

questions.text: All except which of the following are true regarding vaccinations in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaccines that contain toxoids may be administered during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: The hepatitis B vaccine series may be administered during pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination

options.label: D
options.text: Conception should be delayed by 1 month after receiving the rubella vaccine

questions.correct_answer: C. Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Live vaccines, such as varicella and rubella, are contraindicated during pregnancy due to the theoretical risk of harm to the fetus. However, receiving a live vaccine during pregnancy is not an indication for termination . In contrast, vaccines like toxoids (e.g., tetanus) and inactivated vaccines (e.g., hepatitis B) are safe during pregnancy.
  • ➤ not an indication for termination

questions.text: You counsel her that she should initiate 4mg of folic acid daily for at least 3 months prior to her next conception. She asks how this would help. You tell her this will reduce her risk of developing a similar birth defect by?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 70%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Folic acid supplementation of 4 mg daily for at least 3 months before conception and continuing through early pregnancy can reduce the risk of neural tube defects by 70% in women who have had a previous pregnancy affected by NTDs.
  • ➤ 4 mg daily
  • ➤ 3 months before conception
  • ➤ 70%

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman presents with vaginal spotting. She has not had a period for 2 months and her UPT is positive. What is the minimum mean sac diameter measurement necessary to diagnose an anembryonic pregnancy with certainty?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 25mm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A mean sac diameter (MSD) of 25 mm or greater without a visible embryo on ultrasound is diagnostic of an anembryonic pregnancy (blighted ovum). This is an early pregnancy failure where the gestational sac develops, but the embryo does not.
  • ➤ mean sac diameter (MSD) of 25 mm or greater
  • ➤ anembryonic pregnancy

questions.text: A 23-year primigravida presents for induction of labor at 41 weeks. Her Bishop score is 3. You proceed with cervical ripening using the agent shown below. What group of drugs does this belong to?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Prostaglandins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Prostaglandins , particularly misoprostol (PGE1) and dinoprostone (PGE2) , are effective agents used for cervical ripening in labor induction. These drugs promote the softening and dilation of the cervix, especially in patients with a low Bishop score.
  • ➤ Prostaglandins
  • ➤ misoprostol (PGE1)
  • ➤ dinoprostone (PGE2)
  • ➤ cervical ripening

questions.text: A 32-year Primi delivered at 39 weeks by an emergency LSCS for deep transverse arrest. Following delivery of the baby, extension of the uterine incision was noted and sutured. Despite this the patient continued to bleed. The following procedure was done as shown. Which hemostatic surgical procedure is shown?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Uterine Artery ligation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Uterine artery ligation is an effective surgical procedure to control postpartum hemorrhage by reducing blood flow to the uterus. It is performed at the level of the uterine isthmus, as shown in the image, and is commonly done when conservative measures fail to stop bleeding.
  • ➤ Uterine artery ligation

questions.text: A woman comes in for an annual gynecologic examination. During speculum examination, you see the following. What is the most appropriate next step?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Perform a cervical biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When a growth on the cervix is observed during a speculum exam, the appropriate next step is to perform a cervical biopsy . A biopsy provides a definitive diagnosis of the lesion and helps guide further management.
  • ➤ growth on the cervix
  • ➤ cervical biopsy

questions.text: A 30-year-old G2P1 woman with a previous history of caesarean section presents to the ER. She is 38 weeks and has a history of labor pains for a few hours. When you examine her, you find hypotension, tachycardia, and severe abdominal pain. On examination, fetal parts are palpable in the abdomen and Fetal heart cannot be auscultated. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Order blood and shift to the ICU

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Emergency laparotomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Uterine rupture in a patient with a previous caesarean section presents with severe abdominal pain , signs of shock, palpable fetal parts in the abdomen, and absent fetal heart tones. Emergency laparotomy is the only definitive treatment and should be performed immediately to save the mother's life.
  • ➤ Uterine rupture
  • ➤ severe abdominal pain
  • ➤ Emergency laparotomy

questions.text: A 67-year woman presents with a vault prolapse. She had undergone a hysterectomy 15-year earlier for multiple uterine fibroids. What is the best management option for her:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Laparoscopic sacro-colpopexy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For vault prolapse , the best long-term management option is sacrocolpopexy , particularly when performed laparoscopically. It provides durable repair by restoring the vaginal apex to its correct anatomical position and is considered the gold standard for vault prolapse surgery.
  • ➤ vault prolapse
  • ➤ sacrocolpopexy

questions.text: In which situation will you not apply a vacuum?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Fetal demise

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vacuum-assisted delivery is not recommended in the case of fetal demise . It can be used when the fetal head is at 0 station , in certain malpositions (such as occipito-posterior), or even when rotation is incomplete, provided that conditions are suitable and proper techniques are applied.
  • ➤ not recommended
  • ➤ fetal demise
  • ➤ 0 station

questions.text: A 30-year primi undergoes a BPP at 40Weeks 2 days. Which component of the BPP is shown in the image?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Amniotic fluid volume

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a biophysical profile (BPP) , the measurement of amniotic fluid volume is critical to assess fetal well-being. The image shows an amniotic fluid measurement, likely using the single deepest pocket technique.
  • ➤ biophysical profile (BPP)
  • ➤ amniotic fluid volume
  • ➤ single deepest pocket

questions.text: A 40-year-old patient underwent pap smear which was reported to be HSIL. A colposcopy directed biopsy showed CIN – 3. What is the next best management?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) LEEP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient diagnosed with CIN-3 , the preferred treatment is an excisional procedure such as LEEP to remove the transformation zone and dysplastic cells while providing a tissue sample for further histological evaluation. Conization may be considered in specific cases with endocervical involvement or biopsy discrepancies, while hysterectomy is reserved for exceptional cases or additional pathology.
  • ➤ CIN-3
  • ➤ excisional procedure
  • ➤ LEEP
  • ➤ Conization
  • ➤ hysterectomy

questions.text: Identify the attitude of this fetus:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Flexion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The fetal attitude in the image shows flexion , where the fetal chin is tucked into the chest. This is the optimal position for delivery, allowing the smallest diameter (suboccipitobregmatic) to engage and pass through the birth canal.
  • ➤ flexion

questions.text: Arrange the cardinal steps in the order they occur in mechanism of labor? Extension Engagement External rotation Internal rotation
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 2, 4, 1, 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cardinal movements of labor, in sequence, are Engagement , Internal rotation , Extension , and External rotation . These movements are essential for the proper passage of the fetus through the birth canal during delivery.
  • ➤ Engagement
  • ➤ Internal rotation
  • ➤ Extension
  • ➤ External rotation

questions.text: If the fetus enters the pelvis with its sagittal suture in the transverse diameter of the pelvis, internal rotation will happen by how many degrees?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 90°

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When the fetus enters the pelvis with the sagittal suture in the transverse diameter (either LOT or ROT), internal rotation occurs by 90 degrees to align the fetal head with the anteroposterior diameter of the pelvis, facilitating delivery.
  • ➤ sagittal suture in the transverse diameter
  • ➤ internal rotation
  • ➤ 90 degrees

questions.text: You are an intern and are conducting delivery of a 24-year G2P1. The head is delivered and undergoes restitution and external rotation. When you attempt to deliver the anterior shoulder, you notice that there are 2 tight loops of cord around the neck. What is the next best step?

options.label: A
options.text: Try to slip the cords over the fetal head

options.label: C
options.text: Clamp the cord, cut it and unwind it from around the fetal neck

questions.correct_answer: C. Clamp the cord, cut it and unwind it from around the fetal neck
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Clamp the cord, cut it and unwind it from around the fetal neck

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the presence of tight loops of the umbilical cord around the fetal neck during delivery, the correct action is to clamp, cut, and unwind the cord to avoid complications such as fetal blood loss or cord snapping. This allows for a safe delivery to proceed.
  • ➤ tight loops of the umbilical cord
  • ➤ clamp, cut, and unwind

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman presents with vaginal discharge. There is no foul smell or associated pruritis. On examination, there is white discharge and the cervix and vagina are normal. A pH is done which is 4 and a vaginal smear shows the following. What is the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Physiological discharge

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The vaginal pH, clinical presentation, and microscopic findings in this case all suggest physiological discharge , which is a normal part of vaginal health and not indicative of an infection.
  • ➤ physiological discharge

questions.text: A 12-year girl is brought to the OPD by her mother. She is concerned that she is shorter than her peers. On examination there is ptosis on the right side, shield like chest and a webbed neck. On evaluation, which of the following would you expect to find?

options.label: D
options.text: Streak ovaries and a small uterus

questions.correct_answer: D. Streak ovaries and a small uterus
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Streak ovaries and a small uterus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Turner syndrome (45, X) , patients typically present with streak ovaries (leading to ovarian failure) and a small uterus due to estrogen deficiency. Other characteristic features include short stature, webbed neck, and a shield-like chest.
  • ➤ Turner syndrome (45, X)
  • ➤ streak ovaries
  • ➤ small uterus

questions.text: Which of the following is the most commonly used radiation sensitizer for the treatment of cervical cancer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cisplatin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the treatment of cervical cancer , cisplatin is the most commonly used agent to enhance the effectiveness of radiation therapy . It plays a key role in chemoradiation protocols for improving outcomes in patients with locally advanced cervical cancer.
  • ➤ cervical cancer
  • ➤ cisplatin
  • ➤ radiation therapy
  • ➤ chemoradiation

questions.text: A 54-year woman presents to the OPD with several months of irregular vaginal spotting. She does not give a history of heavy bleeding but only that her undergarments are stained with blood. She attained menopause at the age of 52 and she had hot flushes and night sweats for which she was started on the transdermal estrogen patch and progesterone only pills. She has been consistently using the estrogen patches but stopped the progesterone in view of severe nausea. She has no significant medical history. She is on regular HPV screening and her last HPV done 2-year earlier was normal. Speculum exam reveals a normal cervix and vagina with minimal blood in the upper vagina. Bimanual exam reveals a small uterus with no adnexal mass. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: C
options.text: Stop the estrogen patch and place an LNG-IUD

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Transvaginal ultrasound

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a postmenopausal woman with vaginal spotting and a history of unopposed estrogen therapy, the next step is to perform a transvaginal ultrasound to evaluate for endometrial thickness and assess the need for further intervention, such as an endometrial biopsy.
  • ➤ transvaginal ultrasound

questions.text: A resident is demonstrating techniques of delivery of the aftercoming head in breech delivery in the skills lab. You reach late and are witnessing the following maneuver. What is this maneuver?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Burn Marshall

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Burn Marshall maneuver is used to deliver the aftercoming head in breech deliveries by flexing the baby’s body towards the mother’s abdomen, allowing for the spontaneous delivery of the fetal head. This is different from maneuvers like the Mauriceau Smellie Viet and Wigand Martin, which involve more direct manipulation of the fetal head.
  • ➤ Burn Marshall maneuver

questions.text: A patient is being evaluated for urinary incontinence following a hysterectomy. In the 3-swab test, the upper swab is wet. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Uretero-vaginal fistula

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The 3-swab test is a diagnostic method used to locate the site of genitourinary fistulas. A wet upper swab without blue staining suggests a uretero-vaginal fistula , whereas a middle or lower swab stained with methylene blue suggests fistulas originating from the bladder or urethra, respectively.
  • ➤ 3-swab test
  • ➤ wet upper swab without blue staining
  • ➤ uretero-vaginal fistula
  • ➤ middle or lower swab
  • ➤ methylene blue

questions.text: A 24-year woman presents to the antenatal OPD. She is 3 months pregnant. On asking, she tells you that she has a 4-year-old son followed by a twin pregnancy which she terminated at 8 weeks. What is her obstetric formula?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) G3P1A1

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gravida refers to the total number of pregnancies, Para refers to the number of pregnancies that reached viability, and Abortions refers to pregnancies that ended before viability. In this case, the woman is G3P1A1 : three pregnancies, one viable, and one abortion.
  • ➤ Gravida
  • ➤ Para
  • ➤ Abortions
  • ➤ G3P1A1
